owl:Ontology.terms:creator: Bram Steenwinckel
owl:Ontology.terms:title: Failure mode and effect analysis combined with anomaly ontology
owl:Ontology.foaf:name: Folio

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: happenedAt
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between the failure cause and the corresponding device/system.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasCause
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a failure and it corresponding cause.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasDetection
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between the observed element and the detection method

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a failure and it corresponding effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasFailureMode
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between the failure effect and the corresponding failure mode.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasLowerFailureEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a failure effect and a previously occurring effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasNextFailureEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a failure effect and a next effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isEndEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation defining an failure effect as end effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isIntermediateEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation defining an failure effect as intermediate effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isLocalEffect
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation defining an failure effect as the first mentioned effect.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Deployment and the Platform on which the Systems are deployed.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: deployed on platform
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Deployment and the Platform on which the Systems are deployed.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Deployment and a deployed System.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: deployed system
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Deployment and a deployed System.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor can detect. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: detects
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor detects. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: for property
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: For example, from a Sensor to the properties it can observe; from an Actuator to the properties it can act on; from a Deployment to the properties it was installed to observe or act on; from a SystemCapability to the Property the capability is described for.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a System and a Deployment, recording that the System is deployed in that Deployment.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has deployment
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a System and a Deployment, recording that the System is deployed in that Deployment.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has input
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has output
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an entity and a Property of that entity.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has property
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between an entity and a Property of that entity.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a System and its component parts.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has subsystem
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a System and its component parts.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method) and an entity that implements that Procedure in some executable way.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: implemented by
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method) and an entity that implements that Procedure in some executable way.
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: For example, the relationship between a scientific measuring Procedure and a sensor that senses via that Procedure.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an entity that implements a Procedure in some executable way and the Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: implements
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between an entity that implements a Procedure in some executable way and the Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method).
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: For example, the relationship between a sensor and the scientific measuring Procedure via which it senses.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Platform and a Deployment, meaning that the deployedSystems of the Deployment are hosted on the Platform.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in deployment
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Platform and a Deployment, meaning that the deployedSystems of the Deployment are hosted on the Platform.
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: For example, a relation between a buoy and a deployment of several Sensors.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between a Property and the entity it belongs to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is property of
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between a Property and the entity it belongs to.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is proxy for
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:example: For example, the expansion of quicksilver is a stimulus that serves as a proxy for some temperature property. An increase or decrease in the velocity of spinning cups on a wind sensor is serving as a proxy for the wind speed.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: was originated by
owl:ObjectProperty.skos:definition: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: AnomalyKnowledge
owl:Class.skos:definition: Anomaly’s description. Should then express, at least, which part of the system is affected, by what. Ideally, this should be completed with additional information, such as which components observe the anomaly, or the worth of its management.
owl:Class.skos:example: Anomaly’s description. Should then express, at least, which part of the system is affected, by what. Ideally, this should be completed with additional information, such as which components observe the anomaly, or the worth of its management.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Category
owl:Class.skos:definition: An anomaly can happen once (transient), periodically (recurrent) or definitively (permanent).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cause
owl:Class.skos:definition: The cause refers to the description suspected to be the source of the anomaly

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ConsequenceDomain
owl:Class.skos:definition: Each domain relates to a specific kind of consequence of the anomaly.
owl:Class.skos:example: Malfunctioning of device or dangerous situation for end user.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Criticality
owl:Class.skos:definition: It is a time dependent worth attributed to the anomaly management.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DetectionMethod
owl:Class.skos:definition: This relies on components’ survey to trigger a warning about abnormalities.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Effect
owl:Class.skos:definition: The effect describes one aspect of the observed phenomenon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FailureCause
owl:Class.skos:definition: Failure causes are defects in design, process, quality, or part application, which are the underlying cause of a failure or which initiate a process which leads to failure. Also, the failure effect at the highest indenture level or total system. A failure mode may have more causes.
owl:Class.skos:example: (abnormal) vibration input from another (possibly failed) system.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FailureEffect
owl:Class.skos:definition: Immediate consequences of a failure on operation, function or functionality, or status of some item.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FailureMode
owl:Class.skos:definition: The specific manner or way by which a failure occurs in terms of failure of the item (being a part or (sub) system) function under investigation; it may generally describe the way the failure occurs. It shall at least clearly describe a (end) failure state of the item (or function in case of a Functional FMEA) under consideration. It is the result of the failure mechanism (cause of the failure mode)..

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Faulty
owl:Class.skos:definition: The loss of a function under stated conditions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: IntermediateEffect
owl:Class.skos:definition: The failure effect as it applies at the next higher indenture level.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: LocalEffect
owl:Class.skos:definition: The visible failure effect as it applies to the item under analysis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ObservationValue
owl:Class.skos:definition: Value describing the observation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describes the Deployment of one or more Systems for a particular purpose. Deployment may be done on a Platform.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Deployment
owl:Class.skos:definition: Describes the Deployment of one or more Systems for a particular purpose. Deployment may be done on a Platform.
owl:Class.skos:example: For example, a temperature Sensor deployed on a wall, or a whole network of Sensors deployed for an Observation campaign.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any information that is provided to a Procedure for its use.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Input
owl:Class.skos:definition: Any information that is provided to a Procedure for its use.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any information that is reported from a Procedure.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Output
owl:Class.skos:definition: Any information that is reported from a Procedure.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A quality of an entity. An aspect of an entity that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Property
owl:Class.skos:definition: A quality of an entity. An aspect of an entity that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An event in the real world that 'triggers' the Sensor. The properties associated to the Stimulus may be different to the eventual observed ObservableProperty. It is the event, not the object, that triggers the Sensor.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Stimulus
owl:Class.skos:definition: An event in the real world that 'triggers' the Sensor. The properties associated to the Stimulus may be different to the eventual observed ObservableProperty. It is the event, not the object, that triggers the Sensor.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implements Procedures. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: System
owl:Class.skos:definition: System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implement Procedures. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems.

rdf:Description.foaf:name: W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group
W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group
